head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 20 distinct parts:

head.note: This manuscript contains: Andrew of Crete. Portions of a discourse (numbered ܠܛ) by Andrew, a priest of Jerusalem, generally called Andrew of Crete, on the Death and Burial of the blessed Virgin Mary. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Portions of a discourse (numbered ܠܛ) by Andrew, a priest of Jerusalem, generally called Andrew of Crete, on the Death and Burial of the blessed Virgin Mary
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܪܓܡܐ ܕܛܘܒܢܐ ܐܢܕܪܐܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܐܘܪܫܠܡܝܐ. ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܩܒܘܪܬܗ̇ ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ. ܡܪܝܡ. ܘܥܠ ܫܘܢܝܗ̇ ܫܒ̣ܝܚܐ ܘܡܠ̣ܐ ܬܗܪܐ.
msItem.incipit: ܚ̈ܒܝܒܝ܆ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܠܬܐܘܪܝܐ ܕܒܪܘܚ ܒܢܘܗܪܐ ܕܟܝܐ ܘܠܐ ܗܘܠܢܝܐ܇ ܒܝܕܥܬܐ ܕܠܐ ܛܘܥܝܝ ܡܬܬܨܡܚܝܢ܆ ܘܒܡܐܪܙܢܘܬܐ ܠܐ ܡܬܢܦܠܢܝܬܐ ܕܪܘܚܐ܇ ܝܬܝܪ ܡܠܝܠܐܝܬ ܠܘܬ ܕܘ̈ܓܡܐܛܐ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܬܐܘܠܝܓܝܐ ܡܬܗ̇ܕܝܢ: ܬܘ ܕܟܕ ܠܟܠܗ̇ ܝܥܢܘܬܐ ܐܪܥܢܝܬܐ ܡܢܢ ܫ̇ܠܚܝܢܢ: ܘܥܡ ܪܘܚܐ ܐܟܚܕܐ ܪܐܙܢܝܐܝܬ ܡܬܡܙܓܝܢܢ: ܕܠܘܬ ܫܪܘܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܡܬܝܕܥܢܝܬܐ ܘܣܓܝ̣ܐܬ݀ ܢܘܗܪ̈ܐ: ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܒܬܘܠܬܐ ܢܪܗܛ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: It is freely translated and abridged from the first discourse “in Dormitionem sanctissimae Deiparae Dominae nostrae," in the edition of Combefis (Paris, 1644), p. 115 seqq. ; Migne, Patrol. Gr., t. xcvii., col. 805.

msItem.title: The passage regarding Dionysius the Areopagite
ἔιρηται γοῦν προς τινὶ τῶν Θεολόγων ἱερολόγων κ.τ.λ.
Another passage
καὶ θαυμαστὸν οὐδὲν, εἰ τὸ ἐξᾷραν 'Ηλίαν πνεῦμα ποτὲ, κ.τ.λ.

physDesc.p: Two paper leaves, about 10 1/2 in. by 6 7/8, the second of which is much torn. The writing is a neat, regular cursive of the xiiith or xivth cent.

item.p: The second leaf is much torn

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a neat, regular cursive of the xiiith or xivth cent.

msItem.note: Fol. 21 was probably a flyleaf of this volume.

S. Luke, ch. i. v. 46—56

physDesc.p: Nine paper leaves, about 9 3/4 in. by 6 3/4, several of which are much torn (Add. 14,736 , foll. 13—21). The quires are signed with Syriac and Armenian letters (foll. 18 b, 19 a). There are from 15 to 17 lines in each page. The writing is large and coarse, of the xiiith cent.

item.p: Nine paper leaves, about 9 3/4 in. by 6 3/4, several of which are much torn (Add. 14,736, foll. 13—21). The quires are signed with Syriac and Armenian letters (foll. 18 b, 19 a). There are from 15 to 17 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is large and coarse, of the xiiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Prayers; Mansūr. An Arabic prayer by one Mansūr, in behalf of his son Jacob. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Prayers
A Prayer
An Arabic prayer by one Mansūr, in behalf of his son Jacob.

physDesc.p: Four paper leaves, about 9 3/4 in. by 6 5/8, the first of which is slightly torn (Add. 14,736, foll. 49—52). They are numbered with Coptic arithmetical figures from 272 (ϭⲟⲱ) to 275 (ϭⲟⲉ); and the last three formed the 23rd quire of a manuscript. There are 21 lines in each page. They are dated A. Gr. 1794, A.D. 1483.

item.p: Four paper leaves, about 9 3/4 in. by 6 5/8, the first of which is slightly torn (Add. 14,736, foil. 49—52). They are numbered with Coptic arithmetical figures from 272 (𐋴𐋰𐋢) to 275 (𐋴𐋰𐋥); and the last three formed the 23d quire of a manuscript. There are 21 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: They are written in a neat, regular hand, and dated A. Gr. 1794, A.D. 1483.
See additions

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: Colophon:

p.quote: ܗܘ̈ܝ ܗܠܝܢ ܫܢ̣ܬ݂݀ ܐܠܦ̣ܐ ܘܫܒ̣ܥܡܐܐ ܘܬ̣ܫܥܝܢ ܘܐܪܒ̣ܥܐ ܕܝܰܘܳܢ ܘܠܡܪܝܐ ܫܘܼܒ̣ܚܐ ܘܥܠܝܢ ܪ̈ܚܡ̣ܘܗܝ ܠܥܠܡܝܢ ܐܡܝܢ.

item.p: On fol. 49 b there is an Arabic note, recording its presentation as a wakf to the convent of S. Mary Deipara, written apparently in the year 1350 of the Coptic era (A.D. 1634), in the days of Amba Matthew and the abbat 'Abdu’l-Masīh % (sic) % (sic) هدا الكتاب المبارك الدى هو كتاب القداسات سرياني وقفا مخلدا على دير ستنا السيدة بالبرية المقدسة المعروف بالسريان وليس لاحدا (sic) سلطان من قبل الرب سبحانه وتعالي ان يطالعه من الدير المدكور الخ وهدا الوقف في زمن ابونا وتاج راسنا الساهِر عن خلاص نفوسنا ابونا متاوس ادامو الله سنين عديده ويخضع اعداه تحت موطى قدميه وتديم (sic) لنا وعلينا رياسته ]بشفا[عة ستنا سنه قبطيه السيدة وجميع الشهدا والقديسين امين الف وثلثمايه وخمسين .... على زمن رياست ابونا القمص عند المسيح ريس الدير المدكور نسان من ]الرب[ ان يديم رياسته ويرحم الديه امين See Le Quien, Oriens Christ., t. ii. Col. 508 , and Renaudot, Hist. Patr. Alexandr., p. 612 . These numerals are very indistinctly written.
An Arabic prayer by one Mansur, in behalf of his son Jacob.
item.quote: يا مريم يا ام النور انا عندك مسمي مشهور انا عندك واسمي منصور وفي الخطايا مطمور واطلب منك ان تطلبي من ابنك ربي يسوع المسيح ان يحفض (sic ) ابني يعقوب ويطول عمره

William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: An index to a volume, of 49 madrāshē. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: An index to a volume, of 49 madrāshē

physDesc.p: Two paper leaves, about 10 3/4 in. by 6 7/8, the second of which is much torn (Add. 14,736 , foll. 64 and 65). They are neatly written, dated A. Gr. 1803, A.D. 1492.

item.p: Two paper leaves, about 10 3/4 in. by 6 7/8, the second of which is much torn (Add. 14,736, foll. 64 and 65).

handDesc.handNote: They are neatly written, dated A. Gr. 1803, A.D. 1492.
See additions.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: A long note, foll. 64 b and 65 a, stating that this manuscript was written, in the convent of S. Mary Deipara, for the metropolitan Mār Severus (or Cyriacus) of Mount Lebanon , by a priest of the convent of Kartamīn, named Abraham bar Behnām of Beth- Severīnā in Tūr-‘Abdīn.

p.quote: ܠܬܫܒ[ـܘܚܬܐ ܘܐܝܩܪܐ ܘܗܕ]ܪܐ ܘܪܘܡܪܡܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܏ܘܫ. ܐܫܬ݀ܡܠܝ ܘܐܣܬ݁ܝܟ ܘܐܬܚܲܬܡ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܥܠ ܐܝ̣ܕ̈ܝܐ ܕܐܝ܏ܬܘ ܒܝܬ ܓܲܙܐ ܐܘܟܝܬ ܣܝ̣ܡܬܐ ܕܚܡܝ̣ܠ ܒܗ ܘܡܛܟܲܣ ܒܗ ܟܠܗ ܝܘܠܦܢܐ ܕܥܕܬܐ ܕܟܪܘܟܝܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܫܲܢܬܐ. ܣ̣ܛܪ ܡܢ ܡܕܡ ܕܠܐ ܐܝܬ܏ܘ ܐܵܠܨܝܐ ܠܕܪܢ ܗܢܐ ܒܠܝ̣ܠܐ. ܘܠܙܒ̣ܢܢ ܗܢܐ ܡܙܠܗܙܐ. ܐܝܟ ܡ̈ܥܢܝܬܐ ܘܩܐܬܝ̈ܣܡܛܐܣ. ܡܢ ܒܠܰܝ ܡ̈ܠܦܢܐ ܘܝ̈ܕܘܥܬܢܐ܀ ܘܝ̣ܨܸܦ ܘܐܬܚܲܦܛ ܘܐܟܬܒ̣ ܠܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܐܡܝ̣ܪ. ܪܫ̣ܢܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܘܡܕܒܪܢܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܐܚܘܬܐ ܕܒܙܒ̣ܢܗ. ܐܒܘܢ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܘܡܫܲܒܚܐ ܘܬܠܝܬܵܝ ܛܘܼܒ̈ܐ ܘܡܥܠܝܐ. ܪܥܝܐ ܥܝ̣ܪܐ ܘܚܦܝ̣ܛܐ ܘܡܕܒܪܢܐ ܚܟܝܡܐ ܚܕܢܵܝ ܙܒ̣ܢܗ ܘܠܚܘܕܵܝ ܕܵܪܗ ܡܝܛܪܘܦܠܝܛܝܣ ܡܫܒܚܐ ܡܪܝ ܣܐܘܝܪܘܣ ܢܲܟܦܐ ܘܬܡܝܡܐ ܘܪܚܝܩ ܡܢܟܠܗ̇ ܢܟܝܠܘܬܐ ܘܨܢܝܥܘܼܬܐ ܕܗ̣ܘ ܩܘܪܝܩܘܣ ܡܢ ܛܘܼܪܐ ܠܸܒܢܵܢܵܝܵܐ ܕܒܐܘܚ̣ܕܢܐ ܘܫܘܼܠܛܢܐ ܕܛܪܝܦܘܠܝܣ܆ ܥܠ [ܐܝ̣̈ܕܝ ܐܢܫ . . . ] ܘܡܚܝ̣ܠ ܒܟܠ ܘܕܘܝܐ ܘܚ̇ܠܫܐ ܏ܘܫ ܒܫܡܐ ܠܡ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܘܒܥܒ̇ܕܐ ܕܰܝܘܳܢܳܐ. ܘܒܐܣܟܝܡܐ ܐܡ̣ܪܐ ܘܒܣܘܥܪܢܐ ܕܐܝ̣ܒܐ. ܘܒܡܓܪܬ݀ ܪܘܚܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܏ܩܫܝ ܟܕ ܪܚܝ̣ܩ ܐܢ̣ܐ ܡܢ ܟܘܢܝܐ. ܒܪ ܒܗܢܡ ܣܒܝܪܝܢܝܐ ܡܢ ܐܬܪܐ ܕܡܕܢܚܐ ܡܢ ܛܘܪ ܥܲܒܕܝܢ. ܒܪ ܬܘܠܡܕܐ ܕܥܘܡܪܐ ܟܗܢܝܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܡܪܝ ܫܡܥܘܢ ܘܡܪܝ ܫܡܘܐܝܠ ܘܡܪܝ ܓܒܪܐܝܠ. ܟܕ ܬܒ̇ܥ ܐܢ̣ܐ ܚܘܣܝܐ ܡܢ ܐܠܗܐ. ܏ܘܫ. ܘܨܲܠܘ ܥܠ ܕܕܝ ܪܒܢ ܓܒܪܐܝܠ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܏ܘܩܫܝ ܕܐܬܛ̇ܝ̣ܒ ܠܘܬܝ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ. ܘܟܬܒ ܥܡܝ ܠܟܠܗܝܢ ܣܒ̈ܠܬܐ ܕܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ. ܐܝܟ ܕܠܥܘܗ̣ܕܢܐ ܘܚܲܣܝܘܬܐ. ܘܗܠܝܢ ܗܘ̣̈ܝ ܘܐܬܪ̈ܫܸܡܝ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܏ܩܕ ܕܒܝܬ ܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܝܡ ܒܬ܏ܘ. ܕܝܠܢ . . . ܚ̈ܣܝ̣ܡܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝܣ ܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܡܨܪܝܢ. ܘܠܗ̇ ܠܥܕܬܐ ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܐܬܟܬ݂ܒ. ܘܠܝܬ ܠܐܢܫ ܫܘܠܛܢܐ ܏ܘܫ. ܒܫܲܢܬܐ ܕ܏ܐܦܓ ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܢܟܝ̈ܠܐ. ܫܢܬܐ ܡܲܠܝܬ݀ ܥ̈ܩܬܐ ܘܬܐܢ̣ܚ̈ܬܐ ܕܒܗ̇ ܐܬ݂ܐ ܡܘܬܢܐ ܩܲܫܝܐ ܘܡܪܝܪܐ ܘܫܲܪܥܘܛܐ ܒܟܠܗ̇ ܗܕܐ ܐܪܥܐ ܕܡܨܪܝܢ ܘܡܝ̣ܬܘ ܒܗ̇ ܒܢܝ̈ܢܫܐ ܕܠܐ ܡܢܝܢܐ ܘܠܐ ܚܘܫܒܢܐ ܐܝܟ ܩܡܨܐ ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: On fol. 64 a, at the foot of the second column, the scribe has written:

p.quote: ܕܦܓ̇ܥ ܘܩ̇ܪܐ ܘܝ̇ܬܪ. ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠ ܚܛܝܐ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܕܟܬ̣ܒ ܘܥܠ ܥܡّܗ ܪܒܢ ܓܒܪܐܝܠ.

item.p: On fol. 65 b there is another note, slightly mutilated, stating that the book was presented to the convent of S. Mary Deipara by Gregory, metropolitan of Jerusalem , A. Gr. 1827, A.D. 1516

p.quote: . . . ܘܓܢܝ̣ܙ ܡ̣ܢ ܗܘ̈ܢܐ. ܓ݂ܪܝܓ݂ܘܪܝܘܣ ܬܚܘܼܒܐ ܡܝ̣ܛܪܘܿܦ݁ܘܿܠܝܛܐ ܕܐܘܿܪܹܫܠܹܡ. ܐܝ̣ܬܝܗ̇ ܦܸܢ̣ܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܩ̈ܠܐ ܫܘܼܟܢܐ ܚܲܬܝܬܐ ܠܕܝܪܐ ܏ܩܕ ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܲܪܝܡ. ܕܒܡܲܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝ. ܘܟܠܡܲܢ ܕܡܲܦܩ ܠܗ̇ ܡܢܗ̇ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܲܥܗܝܕܐ. ܏ܘܫ. ܗܘ̣̈ܝ ܗܠܝܢ ܫܢܬ݀ ܐܦ̇܏ܟܙ ܝܲܘܢܝܬܐ. ܘ܏ܫ.

item.p: A third, mutilated note, on the same page, contains the date A. Gr. 1929, A.D. 1618.

p.quote: ܘܟܕ ܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܫܢܬ ܐܨ܏ܟܛ ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܒܝܘܡ ܥܐܕܐ . . . ܐܬܛ̇ܝ̣ܒܢ̣ܢ̇ ܚܢܢ ܕܘܝ̈ܐ ܢܐܨܪ ܕܘܝܐ ܒܫܡ . . .

msItem.title: Part of a Calendar of Saints' Days.

physDesc.p: A paper leaf, much torn, apparently of the xvith cent.

item.p: A paper leaf, much torn.

handDesc.handNote: Apparently of the xvith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script
